doc.name: launch url
doc.summary: Launches a url in the appropriate manner for the current system.

description.overview: Use the launch url command to open a url using the default action for the current system. The command performs an action appropriate to the protocol and address provided in the given URL.

parameter.name: urlToOpen
parameter.description: The url to launch. Can be in the following forms:

option.description: will launch in the default browser application if available.
open the file in the associated application
open the dialer with a given phone number

description.value: When launch url is called, LiveCode checks to see if an application is available to handle the URL. If no such application exists, the command returns "no association" in the result.

comments.note: The urlToLaunch must be a standards-compliant URL, in particular file urls must be of the form file://<absolute path>.
comments.important: Mobile: Successfully launching a url will cause another application to open and the requesting application to be quit. The application will receive a shutdown message before this happens.
